thread.title: The conversation with the German Scholz was partially disappointing – Stubb: “I find it a shame” –
thread.title_full: The conversation with the German Scholz was partially disappointing – Stubb: “I find it a shame” –

author: archyworldyscom
title: The conversation with the German Scholz was partially disappointing – Stubb: “I find it a shame” –
text:
President Alexander Stubb views North Korea ‘s alleged involvement in Russian military operations in Ukraine as Russia ‘s weakness.
President of the Republic Alexander Stubb sees claims that North Korean troops are joining the war in Ukraine as a sign of Russia’s desperation.
Stubb met the German chancellor on Tuesday Olaf Scholzin in Berlin.
In the press conference organized at the end of the state visit, Stubb explained the topics of the discussion to the Finnish press. The topics covered were, among other things, strengthening cooperation between the countries and future support for Ukraine.
Additionally, Stubb provided his own assessment of military intelligence claims that North Korea sent its soldiers to the front to support Russia.
In the press conference Stubb calmed fears of North Korea’s possible entry into the war in Ukraine. Escalation and World War III are not a likely scenario for Stubbs.
– I see it more as a weakness of Russia. If North Korea and Iran are allies, things will not go very well, Stubb repeated his earlier statement to Reuters.
Frustration The main focus of the discussions was the war in Ukraine and the means by which Finland and Germany can continue to support the country.
Germany’s reluctance to deliver weapons has been a recurring concern. Stubb said he still has faith in Germany, although he currently has no desire to provide Ukraine with the long-range missiles it so desperately needs.
– Apparently the Taurus missiles will not be removed in the near future to help Ukraine, which I find unpleasant, Stubb described the discussion with Scholz on the topic.
The press asked President Stubb if he had received any messages from Germany to take to Peking. Stubb will pay a state visit to China next week.
– When making a state visit to China, you can always act as a messenger. This is pretty basic diplomacy.
“The US will not withdraw from NATO” Stubb also commented on the American presidential elections at a press conference. The topic interests the European NATO countries, with this choice Donald Trump’s AND Horrible Harris there are sometimes fears that the superpower’s commitment to NATO could have consequences.
– Right now everyone is holding their breath and waiting for the election results. No one dares to say in which direction the situation will go, Stubb has given his opinion on the elections.
Stubb said he is confident that the United States will not abandon NATO, regardless of which of the candidates is elected president.
Stubb reminds us that regardless of who is elected, they all have one thing in common: the desire to maintain the United States as a great power and challenge China.
– If they want to succeed, they need allies. I don’t believe it for a second when it comes to the US withdrawal from NATO, Stubb said.
Stubb also met with the former chancellor on Tuesday Angela Merkel . With him we discussed the same topics discussed with Scholzink, i.e. Russia, the Middle East and NATO.
No previous updates
Stubb and Scholz made short statements to the media as early as 5 pm Finnish time before heading to the personal meeting.
In the briefing, Chancellor Scholz said that Germany and Finland were deepening their cooperation at both EU and NATO levels.
President Alexander Stubb and German Chancellor Olaf Scholz gave short speeches at 5pm. Rosa Bröijer
Scholz reminds that Germany and Finland are staunch supporters of Ukraine in the war against Russia. According to the Chancellor, this will continue to be the case.
– Putin cannot hope that we will abandon Ukraine, Scholz said.
President Stubb believes that the November US presidential election is important for the future of the world.
President Stubb believes that the crisis in the Middle East and the peace negotiations over the war in Ukraine will continue as long as the great power has elected a president.
– I believe that the window of opportunity will open after the US elections, said President Stubb.
The official press conference was held at 7.00 pm.
Furthermore, Stubb’s program includes a bilateral meeting with the president of Iceland Halla Tómasdóttirin with.
Stubb is his companion By Suzanne Innes-Stubb with a two-day visit to Berlin.
In the press conference Alexander Stubb told, among other things, what he talked about with German Chancellor Olaf Scholz. Rosa Bröijer
President Stubb paid a state visit to Germany. Rosa Bröijer
Alexander Stubb and Olaf Scholz also met in May. ZumaWire/MVPHOTOS
#conversation #German #Scholz #partially #disappointing #Stubb #find #shame
